item.description: Photo: Alex Wong/Getty Images Ryan has led Sony Interactive Entertainment since 2019 Sony Interactive Entertainment CEO and president Jim Ryan is retiring from his position leading the PlayStation b...
item.content:encoded: Photo: Alex Wong/Getty Images Ryan has led Sony Interactive Entertainment since 2019 Sony Interactive Entertainment CEO and president Jim Ryan is retiring from his position leading the PlayStation business, Sony announced Wednesday. Bloomberg reporter Jason Schreier first reported the news Wednesday afternoon before Sony published its news release. Ryan will step down in March 2024 after 30 years at Sony and PlayStation. Sony Group Corporation president and chief operating officer Hiroki Totok...

item.title: More game studios are changing the industry by unionizing | Polygon - Gaming
item.description: Photo: Emanuele Cremaschi/Getty Images Union interest continues to grow The game industry is changing. After years of groundwork over the past decade, laid over social media and in the halls of gath...
item.content:encoded: Photo: Emanuele Cremaschi/Getty Images Union interest continues to grow The game industry is changing. After years of groundwork over the past decade, laid over social media and in the halls of gatherings like the Game Developers Conference, workers are organizing into unions in their fight against a history of overwork, low pay, and harassment. Unions are on the rise in the game industry as workers seek to make meaningful, sustainable change. Industry change is following a nationwide trend in...

item.description: Image: Valve Valve‚Äôs shooter is ready for the masses Valve officially released Counter-Strike 2, its sequel/free upgrade to Counter-Strike: Global Offensive, on Wednesday. The game was previously on...
item.content:encoded: Image: Valve Valve‚Äôs shooter is ready for the masses Valve officially released Counter-Strike 2, its sequel/free upgrade to Counter-Strike: Global Offensive, on Wednesday. The game was previously only available to players of CS:GO as part of a limited technical test. Counter-Strike 2 replaces CS:GO on Steam. Valve calls the updated game ‚Äúthe beginning of an exciting new chapter and the largest technical leap in Counter-Strike‚Äôs history.‚Äù CS:GO players won‚Äôt be left behind; all items from CS:GO...

item.content:encoded: Image: Capcom via Polygon Capcom pays homage to an RE4 classic... and the Resident Evil movie? Capcom‚Äôs Resident Evil 4 remake wasn‚Äôt a one-to-one recreation of the 2005 GameCube original. Multiple sequences, like the ridiculous Robo-Salazar battle, were reimagined, while other moments were cut altogether. One of the more devastating cuts for the Resident Evil 4 remake was the infamous laser room, in which Leon S. Kennedy dodges and backflips through an array of instant-kill laser beams. Separ...

item.content:encoded: Virgil van Dijk in FIFA 20. | Image: EA Vancouver/Electronic Arts Just days ahead of EA Sports FC 24‚Äôs release And just like that, it was gone. EA appears to have delisted every FIFA game from every digital game store ‚Äî including Steam, Xbox, and PlayStation ‚Äî just two days ahead of the launch of the first game in its replacement franchise, EA Sports FC 24, on Sept. 29. The delisting happened without warning, but was quickly spotted by players and confirmed by Polygon. On the Xbox Store, title...

item.content:encoded: Image: Paizo You‚Äôll make the Kessel Run in, like, 9 parsecs tops Starfinder, Paizo‚Äôs endlessly unfolding tabletop spacefaring game, helped pave the way for Pathfinder‚Äôs second edition while establishing a clear identity of its own. But across the dozens of books and adventures published since its launch in 2017, a fair bit of rules bloat crept in, Tribble-like ‚Äî especially as it applies to starship combat. Starfinder Enhanced, a 192-page rules resource, clears the decks ahead of the planned se...

item.description: Posted by Micha≈Ç Januszewski, Research Scientist, Google Research The human brain is perhaps the most computationally complex machine in existence, consisting of networks of billions of cells. R...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Micha≈Ç Januszewski, Research Scientist, Google Research The human brain is perhaps the most computationally complex machine in existence, consisting of networks of billions of cells. Researchers currently don‚Äôt understand the full picture of how glitches in its network machinery contribute to mental illnesses and other diseases, such as dementia. However, the emerging connectomics field, which aims to precisely map the connections between every cell in the brain, could help solve...

item.description: Posted by Cheng-Yu Hsieh, Student Researcher, and Chen-Yu Lee, Research Scientist, Cloud AI Team Large language models (LLMs) have enabled a new data-efficient learning paradigm wherein they can ...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Cheng-Yu Hsieh, Student Researcher, and Chen-Yu Lee, Research Scientist, Cloud AI Team Large language models (LLMs) have enabled a new data-efficient learning paradigm wherein they can be used to solve unseen new tasks via zero-shot or few-shot prompting. However, LLMs are challenging to deploy for real-world applications due to their sheer size. For instance, serving a single 175 billion LLM requires at least 350GB of GPU memory using specialized infrastructure, not to mention th...

item.title: A catalogue of genetic mutations to help pinpoint the cause of diseases | DeepMind Blog
item.description: We've released a catalogue of ‚Äòmissense‚Äô mutations where researchers can learn more about what effect they may have. Missense variants are genetic mutations that can affect the function of human prote...
item.content:encoded: We've released a catalogue of ‚Äòmissense‚Äô mutations where researchers can learn more about what effect they may have. Missense variants are genetic mutations that can affect the function of human proteins. In some cases, they can lead to diseases such as cystic fibrosis, sickle-cell anaemia, or cancer. The AlphaMissense catalogue was developed using AlphaMissense, our new AI model which classifies missense variants.

item.content:encoded: Posted by Gabriel Barcik and Duc-Hieu Tran, Research Engineers, Google Research In today's digital age, smartphones and desktop web browsers serve as the primary tools for accessing news and information. However, the proliferation of website clutter ‚Äî encompassing complex layouts, navigation elements, and extraneous links ‚Äî significantly impairs both the reading experience and article navigation. This issue is particularly acute for individuals with accessibility requirements. To improve ...
